alert.note: Alert for Osage (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Saint Louis (Eastern Missouri and West Central Illinois)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 06 at 11:33AM CDT until May 08 at 3:07AM CDT by NWS Saint Louis
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Missouri... Maries River near Westphalia. River forecasts are based on observed precipitation and forecast precipitation for the next 24 hours. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL EARLY SUNDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Maries River near Westphalia. * WHEN...Until early Sunday morning. * IMPACTS...At 12.1 feet, The north end of County Road 521 begins flooding adjacent to the river near this height. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 11:00 AM CDT Friday the stage was 8.1 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late this afternoon to a crest of 10.6 feet this evening. It will then fall below flood stage late this evening. - Flood stage is 10.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecasts (1 pm CDT) Location Stg Stg 1 pm Sat Sun Mon Tue Wed Maries River Westphalia 10.0 8.1 5.4 3.9 3.3 3.0 MSG &&
info.instruction: Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. This product, along with additional weather and stream information, is available at https://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=lsx.
